pageContent: 1   |   P a g e  Work Instruction  Posting Nelnet Payments  Author: Jessica Dover, Senior Technologist, CampusWorks Inc.  First Publication Date: 06/08/2021  PURPOSE  This work instruction provides step by step processes to review and post Nelnet online student payment transactions.  PRECONDITIONS  The user must have a Jenzabar account. The user must know the username and password for their account. The user  must also be logged into Jenzabar to access the windows referenced in this document. Additionally, the user must have  the correct account permi ssions to access the windows. If you believe you should have access and do not, please contact  your immediate supervisor for more instruction.  REVIEWING AND POSTING TRANSACTIONS  1.)   Open Transaction Groups Window (see Figure 1).  Figure 1   –   Transaction Groups window  2.)   Figure 2 depicts how a user may sort by S (Suspended Status)   –   Right Click in yellow section under Status, filter  as Equal. (This is not required but will reduce the number of lines in view.) The user may also sort by date by  clicking on the Date column. T his will sort by ascending dates so the most recent dated transactions will be at  the bottom of the list. 2   |   P a g e  Figure 2   –   Sorting Transactions with Status column  3.)   Choose a Nelnet receipts transaction group and click Edit (see Figure 3).  Figure 3   –   Choosing a Nelnet receipts transaction  4.)   The user will verify transactions by selecting an individual in Receipt   Entry   –   click Edit Detail. 3   |   P a g e  Figure 4   –   Edit Detail in Receipt Entry window  5.)   Review the information in the transaction by moving the slide bar at the bottom of the screen. Click on the  flashlight icon circled in red (Figure 5). 4   |   P a g e  Figure 5   –   Flashlight icon to open Receipt Entry Detail  6.)   This screenshot suggests how to split a payment between multiple year and terms, if needed but not required.  This may only need to be used if a payment is made to cover balances split between semesters.  Figure 6   –   Add Row to split payment between semesters  7.)   Filter to look at year and term selected for payment and ensure there are charges available for the year and  term selected (Figure 7). (May have to search through multiple year and terms to find what the student owes a  balance for.) Right click on payment   line to see Transaction Detail. 5   |   P a g e  Figure 7   –   A/R Inquiry Detail  8.)   Indicate in fields highlighted in Figure 8 to associate payment with correct year and term. Click Save, then Close.  (User may repeat step 7 to verify year and term was updated.)  Figure 8   –   G/L Transaction details 6   |   P a g e  9.)   Return to Transaction Groups window, confirm the transaction selected is the one user reviewed, click Print/Edit  to update transaction to Unposted Status and print report to place in blue folder of all receipts for the day.  Figure 9   –   Print Edit to update transaction status  10.)   By clicking the Post button as seen in Figure 10, the transaction in this group will be officially posted to the  student accounts and the G/L.  Figure 10   –   Posting a transaction group  11.)   Once the Post process is complete a report will be generated as seen in Figure 11. 7   |   P a g e  Figure 11   –   Transaction posting report  END OF WORK INSTRUCTION
